column1: 1 ^ Dominus regnāvit; īrāscantur populī. Quī sedet super cherūbīm; moveātur terra. ^ The Lord hath reigned; let the people be angry. He that sitteth on the cherubims; let the earth be moved.

column2: et excelsus super omnēs populōs. ^ The Lord is great in Sion
quoniam terribile et sānctum est. ^ Let them give praise to thy great name
column3: for it is terrible and holy.

column1: 4 ^ Et honor rēgis jūdicium dīligit; tū parāvistī dīrēctiōnēs; jūdicium et jūstitiam in Jācōbe tū fēcistī. ^ And the king's honour loveth judgment; thou hast prepared directions; thou hast done judgment and justice in Jacob.

column3: quoniam sānctum est. ^ Exalt ye the Lord our God

column1: 6 ^ Mōsēs et Aarōn in sacerdōtibus ejus
column2: et Samuel inter eōs quī invocant nōmen ejus. Invocābant Dominum
column3: et ipse exaudiēbat eōs. ^ Moses and Aaron among his priests
column4: and Samuel among them that call upon his name. They called upon the Lord

column1: 7 ^ In columnā nūbis loquēbātur ad eōs; custōdiēbant testimōnia ejus
column2: et praeceptum quod dedit illīs. ^ He spoke to them in the pillar of the cloud. They kept his testimonies
column3: and the commandment which he gave them.

column2: tū exaudiēbās eōs; Deus tū propitius fuistī eīs
column3: et ulcīscens in omnēs adinventiōnēs eōrum. ^ O Lord our God
column4: thou didst hear them; thou wast a merciful God to them
column5: and taking vengeance on all their inventions.

column2: et adōrāte in monte sānctō ejus
column3: quoniam sānctus Dominus Deus noster. ^ Exalt ye the Lord our God
column4: and adore at his holy mountain
column5: for the Lord our God is holy.
